criteria: Accuracy of Land Claim Identification and Location
descriptions: No land claims are identified or located on the maps.
Identifies or locates only one land claim with significant inaccuracies.
Identifies and locates a few land claims (2-3) but with several inaccuracies in location or claimant.
Identifies and locates most of the land claims (4-5) with some inaccuracies in location or claimant.
Identifies and locates nearly all land claims (6-7) with only minor inaccuracies.
Accurately identifies and locates all land claims by Spain, France, England, Portugal, the Netherlands, Sweden, and Russia on maps of North and South America.
Maps of North and South America are not included or are incomplete with large portions missing.
Maps are included but lack key geographic features necessary for accurate land claim location.
Maps are mostly complete but have some missing or poorly represented geographic features.
Maps are complete and include most relevant geographic features, but some details are lacking.
Maps are detailed and complete, accurately representing most geographic features relevant to the land claims.
Maps are exceptionally detailed and complete, accurately representing all geographic features relevant to the land claims, enhancing the clarity of land claim locations.
Presentation is disorganized and unclear, making it difficult to understand the location of land claims.
Presentation lacks organization, with land claims poorly labeled or identified.
Presentation has some organization, but labels and identifications are sometimes unclear or missing.
Presentation is generally organized, with most land claims clearly labeled and identified.
Presentation is well-organized, with land claims clearly and consistently labeled and identified.
Presentation is exceptionally clear, organized, and visually appealing, providing an intuitive understanding of the land claims and their locations.
